speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: SCENE III. A highway between Rome and Antium.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Enter a Roman and a Volsce, meeting

speaker: Roman
text_entry: I know you well, sir, and you know

speaker: Roman
text_entry: me: your name, I think, is Adrian.

speaker: Volsce
text_entry: It is so, sir: truly, I have forgot you.

speaker: Roman
text_entry: I am a Roman; and my services are,

speaker: Roman
text_entry: as you are, against 'em: know you me yet?

speaker: Volsce
text_entry: Nicanor? no.

speaker: Roman
text_entry: The same, sir.

speaker: Volsce
text_entry: You had more beard when I last saw you; but your

speaker: Volsce
text_entry: favour is well approved by your tongue. What's the

speaker: Volsce
text_entry: news in Rome? I have a note from the Volscian state,

speaker: Volsce
text_entry: to find you out there: you have well saved me a

speaker: Volsce
text_entry: day's journey.

speaker: Roman
text_entry: There hath been in Rome strange insurrections; the

speaker: Roman
text_entry: people against the senators, patricians, and nobles.

speaker: Volsce
text_entry: Hath been! is it ended, then? Our state thinks not

speaker: Volsce
text_entry: so: they are in a most warlike preparation, and

speaker: Volsce
text_entry: hope to come upon them in the heat of their division.

speaker: Roman
text_entry: The main blaze of it is past, but a small thing

speaker: Roman
text_entry: would make it flame again: for the nobles receive

speaker: Roman
text_entry: so to heart the banishment of that worthy

speaker: Roman
text_entry: Coriolanus, that they are in a ripe aptness to take

speaker: Roman
text_entry: all power from the people and to pluck from them

speaker: Roman
text_entry: their tribunes for ever. This lies glowing, I can

speaker: Roman
text_entry: tell you, and is almost mature for the violent

speaker: Roman
text_entry: breaking out.

speaker: Volsce
text_entry: Coriolanus banished!

speaker: Roman
text_entry: Banished, sir.

speaker: Volsce
text_entry: You will be welcome with this intelligence, Nicanor.

speaker: Roman
text_entry: The day serves well for them now. I have heard it

speaker: Roman
text_entry: said, the fittest time to corrupt a man's wife is

speaker: Roman
text_entry: when she's fallen out with her husband. Your noble

speaker: Roman
text_entry: Tullus Aufidius will appear well in these wars, his

speaker: Roman
text_entry: great opposer, Coriolanus, being now in no request

speaker: Roman
text_entry: of his country.

speaker: Volsce
text_entry: He cannot choose. I am most fortunate, thus

speaker: Volsce
text_entry: accidentally to encounter you: you have ended my

speaker: Volsce
text_entry: business, and I will merrily accompany you home.

speaker: Roman
text_entry: I shall, between this and supper, tell you most

speaker: Roman
text_entry: strange things from Rome; all tending to the good of

speaker: Roman
text_entry: their adversaries. Have you an army ready, say you?

speaker: Volsce
text_entry: A most royal one; the centurions and their charges,

speaker: Volsce
text_entry: distinctly billeted, already in the entertainment,

speaker: Volsce
text_entry: and to be on foot at an hour's warning.

speaker: Roman
text_entry: I am joyful to hear of their readiness, and am the

speaker: Roman
text_entry: man, I think, that shall set them in present action.

speaker: Roman
text_entry: So, sir, heartily well met, and most glad of your company.

speaker: Volsce
text_entry: You take my part from me, sir; I have the most cause

speaker: Volsce
text_entry: to be glad of yours.

speaker: Roman
text_entry: Well, let us go together.

speaker: Roman
text_entry: Exeunt
